This is the best torch I've ever used. Lots of options (colours, brightness, pulse, SOS, dazzle, etc) and tough too. The charge lasts for ages and even when it is running out of charge you can use the low energy settings (e.g. the less bright lights). I used this recently for beach walking at night and it lit the whole place up. I also use it on a low setting if I need to move around the house at night without disturbing other people.

Dont look at it if it is on full as it will hurt your eyes, also be aware that it gets warm when on for a while (hence the vents at the front).

Don't be confused when trying to charge it. Plug the phone-like charger into the wall and make sure the torch is turned ON, then just connect the wire from the charger to the torch and it will begin charging (the torch light will go out while charging).

Overall, I would definitely buy this again if I needed another torch.

Mai visto nulla del genere! Questa torcia ha una motenza incredibile, attivando la modalità turbo, il tiro aumenta in maniera esponenziale, raggiungendo i 350m circa... Se non di più! La consiglio davvero, soprattutto per chi come me lavora nella vigilanza.
Modifico il post riguardante la ricarica della batteria tramite cavo USB. Seguite i passaggi per come li scrivo.
1) rimuovere la batteria se inserita da parecchio tempo ed inserite la nuovamente nella torcia, in modo che l'interfaccia utente verrà resettata.
2) accendere la torcia in modalità Moon light (sarebbe il livello più basso di luminosità).
3) inserire il cavo usb nell'apposito ingresso della torcia mentre è accesa.
4) dopo aver fatto ciò, la torcia si spegne automaticamente ed entra in modalità ricarica, dove il led dei tasti - + lampeggerà in maniera lenta, confermando la corretta modalità di ricarica.
5) una volta carica, il led dei tasti - + rimarrà fisso, confermando la carica completa.
6) scollegando il cavo USB dalla torcia, questa si accenderà di nuovo, (tranquilli, è normale) quindi spegnere la torcia.

reviews:
qui si parla di una torcia semiprofessionale con materiali anodizzati ecc. ed il costo mi sembra quindi adeguato.
Come resa luminosa, parlo del led bianco, non ho la possibilità di verificare se arriva ai 1.000 lumen dichiarati, è molto potente questo sì.
Peccato che non abbia la possibilità di regolare l'ampiezza del fascio luminoso che a me sembra un pò "stretta"
Per i tre led colorati, blu, rosso e verde servono per scopi ben precisi:
potete accenderli singolarmente od anche avere l'effetto lampeggiatore americano con luci rosse e blu.
non hanno la stessa potenza del led bianco ma si vedono, non servono per vederci ma farsi vedere.
Se non vi occorrono i led colorati...onestamente opterei forse per una torcia a led bianco e bona lè.
Utilizza una batteria al litio classica e molto versatile, una 18650 che NON viene fornita!
utilizzatene una con un "serbatoio" di 3.400 mAh che alla massima potenza la danno per un ora di autonomia. Potrà sembrare poco ma questi led molto performanti hanno bisogno di molta "energia".
Sul fondello della torcia troverete il classico interruttore gommato per on/off, personalmente se era nel corpo torcia l'avrei preferito.
Nel corpo torcia troverete i due tasti gommati affiancati per la regolazione della potenza luminosa, attivazione strobo, segnalazione Morse di SOS, led colorati e lampeggiante Usa.... a mio personale parere non di facilissima intuizione.
Nella confezione, molto curata, sono compresi:
la torcia
un laccio da polso
una clip metallica
un cavetto micro USB x la ricarica (non c'è l'alimentatore, solo il cavetto)
una custodia da cintura, molto pratica che si può mettere e togliere senza doverla sfilare dalla cintura.
Istruzioni anche in italiano
ricordatevi che NON troverete nessuna batteria!!!
Molto comodo poter ricaricare la batteria senza doverla togliere dalla torcia anche se mi sembra molto più lenta che ricaricare le 18650 con il loro carichino ad hoc, ma alle volte se non hai una batteria di ricambio una qualsiasi alimentazione USB la recuperi....opportunità non male!
Se non sbaglio, per ricaricarla con il cavetto occorre che la torcia sia accesa altrimenti non parte la ricarica.
In conclusione: una signora torcia, molto potente, a prova d'acqua e di urto, versatile e che utilizza una signora batteria, con la caratteristica dei led colorati che a mio parere, mi sembrano dei gadget se non usati per scopi specifici, sicurezza, protezione civile ecc. ecc.ma poi dove sta scritto che deve per forza essere tutto utile, è una particolarità che poche torce hanno.....

review_title: Technisch gut Lampe, nur Amazon hat geschludert
reviews:
Lampe technisch super gut, aber Amazon hat Lampe mit französischer Anleitung geschickt.
Ist faktisch nicht so schlimm, da Nitecore eine gute Webpräsenz hat incl. vollständigen Download-Bereich, haben nicht alle Hersteller.
Eine Lampe mit viel Funktionen/Farben gut bedienbar zu machen ist nicht leicht - ich war überrascht, dass dies Nitecore gut gelungen ist. Vor allem, dass man in Off-Zustand zwei (für mich sinnvolle) Modi quasi vorwählen kann, denn - wie üblich - wird bei den meisten die letzte Einstellung gespeichert, aber "...wie war die vorher...?".
Was ich auch gut finde, ist der für eine 1000 Lumen-Lampe vorhandene Ultra-Low-Modus mit 1 Lumen.
Das weiße Hauptlicht ist schön fokussiert, ohne Ringe o.ä., allerdings leuchten die drei farbigen, am Reflektor aussen plazierten LED doch wild umher, geht technisch vermutlich nicht anders, wenn der weiße Hauptbeam nicht negativ beeinflusst werden soll. Will man einen weiten, sauberen R/G/B-Strahl, muss man vermutlich die optionalen Farbfilter verwenden.
Haptisch hochwertig, wenn diese so lange hält wie meine erste Nitecor, dann bin ich zufrieden (diese habe ich schon gefühlt eine Ewigkeit und funktioniert noch wie am ersten Tag, im Gegensatz zu etlichen anderen Herstellern, habe zwei Fenix und eine Oligt, halbdefekt).

reviews: Tagelang habe ich alle derzeitigen Produkte gewälzt. Für unter 100 EUR gibt es nicht eine weitere Taschenlampe, die von der Leistung und den Features mithalten kann. Direkt per Micro-USB aufladbar, rot/gruen und blau/UV integriert, Baecon, SOS, Emergency, Strobo. Schön klein, kommt mit Holster und Trageband. Bedienung ist ganz gut durchdacht. Taktischer Knopf und -Ring gut gelungen. Gesamte Verarbeitung (bis auf den etwas schief eingebauten Micro USB Port, was aber niemanden stoert und auch niemand sieht) sehr hochwertig. Und dann natürlich das Hauptargument: 1000 Lumen in sinnvollen Abstufungen als gut verbauter Flooder, trotzdem wird für die Umgebungsbeleuchtung genug abgestrahlt um diese Taschenlampe sinnvoll als Weggefährten einsetzen zu können. 2000 Lumen hätte mir auch gefallen, aber für diese Gerätegröße ist zum Produktionszeitpunkt 1000 Lumen halt nun mal der Standard und für Normalos zur Beleuchtung beim Spaziergang sowieso bereits zu hell. Die rote LED ist toll, um bei Nacht nicht die Nachtsichtfähigkeit zu verlieren, die grüne LED werde ich wohl nicht brauchen, da ich kein Jäger bin, aber ich habe mich für die blaue LED entschieden, da diese heller als UV sein soll und mir bei Nebel sicher gute Dienste leisten wird. Nun kann ich nach dem Durchlesen der weiteren Rezensionen nur hoffen, dass ich lange Spaß an den farbigen LEDs haben werde, dies ist meine einzige Sorge. Ich habe mir dazu noch den passenden Nitecore Diffusor bestellt (gabs leider nicht bei Amazon), bei dem es sich um einen Aufsatz handelt, durch den man aus der Taschenlampe eine Campingleuchte macht. Funktioniert ganz gut, die Spitze des Diffusors ist aber gleissend hell. Eventuell bringt das Anstrahlen einer hellen Fläche mehr, doch ich freue mich, dass ich den Diffusor habe, denn in der Natur sind helle Flächen eher selten. Schade ist, das beim Ladebetrieb die LEDs nicht eingeschaltet werden können. So ist ein Dauerbetrieb an einem Akkupack nicht möglich. Der Ladebetrieb ist sowieso undokumentiert verwunderlich: Wenn man die Lampe ausschaltet und dann die Lampe auflädt, blinkt die Seitenschalter LED sehr schnell in blau. Dies bedeutet laut Handbuch "Ladefehler", z.b. Akku nicht richtig eingelegt. Was tun? Lampe einschalten (!). Erst dann wechselt die Lade-LED auf langsames blaues Blinken (= laden). Beim Abziehen des Kabels würde dann die Lampe sofort angehen, also vorher erst wieder ausschalten. Den Sinn habe ich nicht verstanden, aber das ist nun auch Meckern auf sehr hohem Niveau. Zum derzeitigen Zeitpunkt muss ich nämlich sagen: Eine 120%ige Kaufempfehlung, was für ein fantastisches Gadget, ich bin fast verliebt in diese Taschenlampe.

review_title: There are many reliable brands of flashlights on the market today, is Nitecore one of them?
reviews:
I like this flashlight and the options it has. Only problem is that it will NOT charge any of my 18650 batteries. I even have Nitecore 18650 batteries and it wont charge those either. I always get the quick flashing blue light which indicates either a damaged or incorrectly inserted battery. I have over 20 of these batteries and doubt all of them are bad. The battery is not inserted incorrectly or it wouldn't work and the light does turn on and display all colors and modes, it just wont charge anything through its own micro USB port. Buyer beware as I notified Nitecore and have heard nothing in return from them in regards to this matter.
***UPDATE***......Nitecore did notify me and it turns out that the flashlight needs to be turned ON in order to charge the 18650 battery inside. Documentation should state that, but it doesn't. So now I will have to say that I give this flashlight 5 stars and that perhaps an error on my part existed which shouldn't affect their product in a review. Thank you for the quick response Nitecore.

review_title: I'm still happy since this was still 30$ cheaper than other places ...
reviews:
Few issues. I was under the impression this would come with a battery. My mistake. I'm still happy since this was still 30$ cheaper than other places I looked. So I went to the store and bought a battery. It works, but I accidentally bought a 3.6v instead of a 3.7v. I don't know if this is causing my problem. The flashlight will not run 1000 lumens on a full charge. I have to run it at a lower setting for a half hour before it will begin to work. After that the flashlight is 5 star. To ensure it's not my battery I've ordered a Nitecore 3400 the exact battery it's supposed to work with. When I receive this, i will test again and edit this review. If it doesn't work with the Nitecore battery, i'll be returning this for the same flashlight. Satisfied with the product, just hope the new battery resolves my issues.

EDIT: 5/24/16 Received the battery and went on a week long hiking trip. Flashlight is now working perfectly. Zero issues. Just make sure you get the right battery. Flashlight is durable, and built well. The only thing I haven't tested is the waterproof part. I'm always reluctant to test that theory.

EDIT: 4/4/18. Flashlight is still working flawlessly. Not sure why others are having issues. Battery holds a charge, even when I don't use the flashlight for months. Submersed in water a while back. No issues. Currently looking at buying another Nitecore flashlight. (keep in mind I don't beat on my stuff. Never dropped my flashlight, and I'm yet to use the strike bezel as I haven't had the need to bash someones face in yet.)

reviews: The MH27 is an extremely useful light on several levels. First it is an excellent standard use flash. Plenty of throw and useful peripheral light. Small enough to fir in a jacket pocket for evening into night walks. Large enough to be easily handled and manipulated. The Color options add another dimension to this light that few lights can offer. The red led is especially useful for those night time calls of nature that us old people have all to frequently. I also find that the blue and green seem easier on my eyes and that my night vision returns quicker compared to white light. It has useful run times if you keep it out of turbo. I keep this light by my bedside and use it about every night. I think that having a spare battery and this light would be extremely advantageous in a power outage as well. As to power outages if you bought a dozen CR123's which have a shelf life of years you would be able to weather most power outages that come along. Overall all this is a good homeowner light as it functions well on several levels.

review_title: Overall good with some weird low-battery behaviors
reviews: Definitely a more throwy light but with a moderate amount of spill. Develops very weird behaviors when low on battery. Actually on a second replacement light because the first had issues with the red LED being very dim and only going to maybe the 1st and 4th brightness levels. On the replacement light, once the battery was low the light kept switching only between green and blue until turned off. Then would only stay on low then move to only green and blue again. This behavior disappeared with fresh batteries. I've only used CR123s in the light, not 18650s so can't comment on the charging functions. For me, the light is too big to be an EDC (wasn't expecting it to be); the head is a fairly significant chunk. If I'm carrying it, it is usually in the holster or a jacket pocket. The light will lock-out with a quarter turn of the tailcap.
